page.title: 07Brizes Lodge Farm, Leafield
page.content:
Brizes Lodge is on the edge of the ancient Wychwood forest. The Lodge is 400 years old and Roman objects have been found there. It was surrounded by forest until 1863 when the land was cleared and the farm was built. Today deer sometimes jump over fences and damage the crops and trees.
Brizes Lodge is a mixed family farm. Mr.Cashman is the tenant who rents the farm from Cornbury estate. Crop including oats, wheat, barley and beans for cattle and pigeon feed are grown in the fieds. Amongst the crop sprayer can not reach. Some land is used for grazing sheep or cows.
